MemberSignature.Value: public int CheckScriptNamespace (string nsUri);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 CheckScriptNamespace(string nsUri) cil managed
Public Function CheckScriptNamespace (nsUri As String) As Integer
public: int CheckScriptNamespace(System::String ^ nsUri);

Docs.summary: Checks that the extension and script namespaces do not clash.
Docs.returns: An integer used for internal infrastructure only.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool ElementAvailable (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name);
.method public hidebysig instance bool ElementAvailable(class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name) cil managed
Public Function ElementAvailable (name As XmlQualifiedName) As Boolean
public: bool ElementAvailable(System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^ name);

Docs.summary: Evaluates the argument to a string that is an XML qualified name. This method implements the element-available function specified by [W3C XSL Transformations (XSLT)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=49919).
Docs.returns: if the [expanded name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=148269) is the name of an instruction. If the has a namespace URI equal to the XSLT namespace URI, then it refers to an element defined by XSLT. Otherwise, the expanded-name refers to an extension element. If the has a null namespace URI, the element-available function will return .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The qualified name is expanded into an `expanded name` by using the namespace declarations in scope for the expression. The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.ElementAvailable%2A> function returns `true` if and only if the `expanded name` is the name of an instruction.

Docs.param: A string that contains the message resource.
A list of strings that represent arguments to the method.
Docs.summary: Formats an exception message composed of a format string supplied by the parameter and arguments contained by the parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public string FormatNumberDynamic (double value, string formatPicture, System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName decimalFormatName, string errorMessageName);
.method public hidebysig instance string FormatNumberDynamic(float64 value, string formatPicture, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName decimalFormatName, string errorMessageName) cil managed
Public Function FormatNumberDynamic (value As Double, formatPicture As String, decimalFormatName As XmlQualifiedName, errorMessageName As String) As String
public: System::String ^ FormatNumberDynamic(double value, System::String ^ formatPicture, System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^ decimalFormatName, System::String ^ errorMessageName);

Docs.param: that contains the value to format.
String that contains the format picture.
String that contains the error message name.
Docs.summary: Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: Returns a string that indicates the number format. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.FormatNumberDynamic%2A> method formats `value` by using the `formatPicture` and decimal-format [expanded name](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=148269). The `errorMessageName` is used only for error reporting and must contain the qualified name of the decimal-format object.

MemberSignature.Value: public string FormatNumberStatic (double value, double decimalFormatterIndex);
.method public hidebysig instance string FormatNumberStatic(float64 value, float64 decimalFormatterIndex) cil managed
Public Function FormatNumberStatic (value As Double, decimalFormatterIndex As Double) As String
public: System::String ^ FormatNumberStatic(double value, double decimalFormatterIndex);

Docs.summary: Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: A string that indicates the format. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.FormatNumberStatic%2A> method formats the given value by using the given decimal formatter object, created by <xref:System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XsltLibrary.RegisterDecimalFormatter%2A>.

Docs.summary: Determines whether two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded-names, the same expanded names.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value that is if two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded names, the same expanded names.

MemberSignature.Value: public int RegisterDecimalFormat (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 RegisterDecimalFormat(class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters) cil managed
Public Function RegisterDecimalFormat (name As XmlQualifiedName, infinitySymbol As String, nanSymbol As String, characters As String) As Integer
public: int RegisterDecimalFormat(System::Xml::XmlQualifiedName ^ name, System::String ^ infinitySymbol, System::String ^ nanSymbol, System::String ^ characters);

Docs.summary: Registers a decimal-format with the given expanded name. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: In the current implementation the return value is always 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public double RegisterDecimalFormatter (string formatPicture, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters);
.method public hidebysig instance float64 RegisterDecimalFormatter(string formatPicture, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters) cil managed
Public Function RegisterDecimalFormatter (formatPicture As String, infinitySymbol As String, nanSymbol As String, characters As String) As Double
public: double RegisterDecimalFormatter(System::String ^ formatPicture, System::String ^ infinitySymbol, System::String ^ nanSymbol, System::String ^ characters);

Docs.param: String that contains the format picture.
String that contains the infinity symbol.
String that contains the NaN symbol.
String that contains characters to format.
Docs.summary: Registers a decimal formatter object and returns a unique index assigned to it. The decimal formatter object is used by the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the [number formatting](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144247) section in the W3C Recommendation.
Docs.returns: Returns a unique index of type assigned to a decimal formatter object.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool RelationalOperator (double opCode, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right);

.method public hidebysig instance bool RelationalOperator(float64 opCode, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right) cil managed
Public Function RelationalOperator (opCode As Double, left As IList(Of XPathItem), right As IList(Of XPathItem)) As Boolean

public: bool RelationalOperator(double opCode, System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Xml::XPath::XPathItem ^> ^ left, System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Xml::XPath::XPathItem ^> ^ right);

Docs.param:
Specifies how to perform the evaluation of two expressions:
If opCode is equal to 2, evaluates the XPath expression "left < right".
If opCode is equal to 3, evaluates the XPath expression "left <= right".
If opCode is equal to 4, evaluates the XPath expression "left > right".
If opCode is equal to 5, evaluates the XPath expression "left >= right"
Docs.summary: Evaluates whether the expression is greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to, the expression based on the passed.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value that is true if the left expression is greater than or equal to the right expression.
